alert.note: Alert for Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 3:49AM EDT until July 10 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... North Branch Raritan River At Raritan affecting Somerset County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Branch Raritan River At Raritan. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding begins upstream on Black River Road. At 10.0 feet, Flooding occurs along Old York Road and in North Branch Village. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EDT Monday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 AM EDT Monday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.4 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage later this morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.3 feet on 04/03/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date North Branch Rar Raritan 10.0 10.3 Mon 3 am 5.4 3.7 10.4 8am 7/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 230 PM EDT.
